SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.jaunt_api
Class UserAgent

java.lang.Object
  com.jaunt_api.UserAgent

public class UserAgent
extends java.lang.Object

UserAgent class represents a lightweight, headless browser for XML, XHTML and XML documents. When the UserAgent loads an HTML or XML page, it represents it as a Document object. The Document object exposes the content through a tree-like document object model (DOM). The DOM consists of Nodes, such as Element objects, Text objects, and Comment objects. HTML documents, for example, begin with the <html> Element, who's child nodes are <head> and <body> Elements. Each Element contains zero or more attributes (such as <body id='main'>) and zero or more children. The children can be Text objects, Comment objects, or other Element Objects.

addBasicAuthenticator

public void addBasicAuthenticator(java.lang.String realmName,
                                  java.lang.String userId,
                                  java.lang.String password)
When an authenticator is added, it must specify a realm but may or may not specify the protected directory. Every time a request is sent, the UserAgent searches for authenticators that match the (protected directory) of the request. If found, the authenticator is used to send a pre-emptive authentication header. If no pre-emptive authentication header is sent, the server will ask for one with the www-authenticate header, which the ua looks for in all replies from the server. if the server request is detected, ua finds the authenticator with the matching realm, update's that authenticator's protected-directory setting, and re-sends the request with the authenticator's username & password, ie with header Authentication: Basic <username:password^gt;, where <> denotes base64 encoding. The next time a request is sent to the domain, the authorization should be pre-emtive since the protected-directory is now set in the authenticator.

addBasicAuthenticator

public void addBasicAuthenticator(java.lang.String realmName,
                                  java.lang.String protectedDir,
                                  java.lang.String userId,
                                  java.lang.String password)
Adds a BasicAuthenticator to the collection of BasicAuthenticators.

Parameters:
protectedDir - is an absolute url to the protected directory.
